reviews.review_msg: I loved this course with Dr. Munro. He's organized, smart, explains concepts well, nice, but rather callous. Exams are factual and tough. 330 IS A PHYSICS-HEAVY COURSE. Get ready for: acoustic principles, wave calculations, complex waves, harmonic analysis, source-filter theory, VOT measurement, Praat. Lowest A+ boundary in upper Ling for a reason.

Taken in intersession format. Your grade will largely depend on the quality of your group members, completion grades for homework, and a dice roll. You can try seeking clarification with the TA on the dice roll element of your grade. You will not get a satisfactory answer. Advice: Join a group whenever possible and pull your own weight.

Good - The course is graded very leniently. Bad - 60% of your grade comes from two group projects. Choose groupmates wisely! I DO NOT RECOMMEND taking this course in the intersession format. It is too rushed and there is not enough time to work on the projects, especially if you have a bad group.

Got >95% on both exams but end up not getting an A which is at least 90% of total mark. The marking criteria of the final assignment and the presentation are not clear which can easily drop your grade.
easy to pass and easy to get great marks, I even do not need to do besides two assignment
prof with no passion in teaching. she doesn't teach!!   she just wants students to be an RA in her lab :( manipulative!

Took the course in 1084. Mainly uses WaveSurfer. Participation and two lab assignments = 25% grade given to you. Take home exam is brutal, make sure you use the two week time she provides. Not an exam where an all-nighter is sufficient. Presentation & paper, and a midterm. No final exam. She's an approachable and nice lady!

Wang may not be a native speaker, but she's fairly generous with her grades. 330 was mainly about learning to use WaveSurfer and read spectrograms, etc., so if you understand that, you'll get at least a B in this class. She's a sweet, very caring lady too!
very boring class.. some questions on exams are totally not expected.. some assignments are meaningless/irrelivant

One of the nicest prof @ SFU. Focused way too much on review of L130 (felt like I was in L130 again). Projects seemed to easy/irrelevent to course. Midterm focused on irrelevent topics (L130, not L330 material). Very nice,helpful and knowledgable in speech science topics.  :)
Thanks Dr. Roberts, I luv your course and thank you for teaching that valuable materials and you making learning so fun !
I agree with some comments.  His tests are identitcal from course to course so unfair advantage there.  For a good mark, go to office hours ask questions and suck up; that's what works here.
He's a cool teacher! The material is not too difficult and its very easy to study for his exams. I enjoy his class so much!
he is so helpful. as long as u talk to him abut ur hardworkingness, he will give u extra credits to encourage you.
The exams given to us were identical to his 130 class.  Needless to say you enter 401 unprepared.  However, his theoretical ideas make the course worth while if you are not going on in phonetics.

He really keeps the class interactive, constantly engaging his students. It makes for a really interesting class that you never could fall asleep in. He goes a little slow though, and doesn't necessarily cover much more than Ling 130.
I love Zita!! She makes complex material easy to understand, and she's very fair to students. I learned so much from this course.
